decks.notes: The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures like Pelt Collector, Zhur-Taa Goblin, and Gruul Spellbreaker. By utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Questing Beast, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently to the opponent. The inclusion of cards such as Embercleave and Skarrgan Hellkite provide additional power and finishers to close out games. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through ramping up with mana and generating value with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Field of the Dead, and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim. By utilizing cards like Time Wipe and Agent of Treachery, it aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. The deck is designed to outvalue opponents by generating an overwhelming board presence with powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Beanstalk Giant. With a mix of control elements and ramp, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its strong late-game potential.

This deck focuses on aggressively ramping up with mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to quickly play powerful threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis provide additional pressure and card advantage. Deputy of Detention serves as removal while Wicked Wolf acts as a flexible threat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient creatures and powerful planeswalkers, using cards like Once Upon a Time to find key pieces and Fabled Passage for mana fixing.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly with mana-producing creatures like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, allowing you to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Questing Beast early on. Cards like Oko, Nissa, and Once Upon a Time provide additional utility and card advantage to keep the pressure on your opponent. Disdainful Stroke helps protect your key creatures from removal spells, while Wicked Wolf provides a strong removal option. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive curve while maintaining card advantage and tempo.

This deck focuses on controlling the battlefield by using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa, along with efficient removal spells and counters like Deputy of Detention. The ramp package with cards like Growth Spiral and Paradise Druid helps accelerate into big threats like Hydroid Krasis. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional control options and disruption for the opponent. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and take over the game with its powerful late-game threats while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells to deal damage as fast as possible. It utilizes cards like Fervent Champion, Bonecrusher Giant, and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell to boost damage output, while also including cards like Cavalcade of Calamity and Tibalt, Rakish Instigator to add extra pressure. The goal is to end the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize, using efficient creatures and burn spells to push through damage and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence by playing aggressive creatures and equipping them with powerful equipment like Steelclaw Lance and Embercleave. It utilizes creatures like Rotting Regisaur, Rimrock Knight, and Knight of the Ebon Legion to deal damage quickly, while cards like Inspiring Veteran and Blacklance Paragon provide buffs to the team. Acclaimed Contender helps search for key creatures and Fervent Champion adds to the aggressive strategy. The deck runs on a Mardu color combination to utilize a variety of powerful lands and maintain consistency in mana production.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Gilded Goose, Questing Beast, and Wicked Wolf, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko and Nissa to control the game and generate card advantage. By ramping into threats like Hydroid Krasis and leveraging disruption spells such as Disdainful Stroke, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and resilience. With a strong mana base featuring cards like Once Upon a Time and Temple of Mystery, the deck can consistently deploy threats and disrupt opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful threats such as Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. It utilizes cards like Once Upon a Time and Growth Spiral to accelerate its game plan, while also controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Realm-Cloaked Giant. The key idea is to establish a strong board presence with multiple lands and tokens from Field of the Dead, and overwhelm the opponent with versatile threats and removal spells. The deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure a victory through strong mid-game and late-game plays.

The key focus of this Simic Aggro deck is to establish a strong board presence early on with powerful threats like Gilded Goose, Questing Beast, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Paradise Druid and Maraleaf Pixie, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive plays from cards like Brazen Borrower and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck also incorporates some removal options like Wicked Wolf and Voracious Hydra to deal with opposing threats while maintaining pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Growth Spiral to get ahead of the opponent, while also controlling the board using Teferi, Time Raveler to bounce threats and win with powerful finishers like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also utilizes Field of the Dead to generate a steady stream of zombie tokens for defense and pressure. With a mix of ramp, control, and strong late game threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent while staying ahead in resources and board presence.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana as quickly as possible with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Growth Spiral, and Once Upon a Time to be able to cast big threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, Hydroid Krasis, and Agent of Treachery. The main win condition is overwhelming the opponent with multiple Field of the Dead triggers by casting multiple lands each turn. The deck also features some control elements with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Realm-Cloaked Giant to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and playing big threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis to control the board. With a mix of different gates and utility lands, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a wide variety of powerful spells and creatures. The deck also includes some powerful control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Wipe to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of ramp, control, and big creatures.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route, while using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The strategy revolves around using powerful cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis to control the board and generate card advantage. Fae of Wishes allows for the deck to fetch specific answers from the sideboard, while Deafening Clarion and Time Wipe help to control the opponent's board state. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with a variety of threats and resources.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells and threats, controlling the board with removal and counters, and ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of zombie tokens from Field of the Dead. The key strategy is to efficiently ramp into Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to search for lands and generate value, while also countering threats with Teferi, Time Raveler and controlling the board with Time Wipe and Agent of Treachery. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control, ramp, and powerful late-game threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells without using mana. It aims to control the game by playing powerful creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis, while generating value with cards like Fae of Wishes and Beanstalk Giant. The main win condition is Field of the Dead, which can quickly overwhelm opponents with zombie tokens. The deck also includes a variety of gates to ensure it can consistently hit its land drops and activate Golos's ability. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and outvalue opponents with its powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish control of the board and gain card advantage through ramp spells like Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis, while also utilizing Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes board wipes like Time Wipe and Realm-Cloaked Giant to deal with threats and maintain control. The inclusion of cards like Kenrith, the Returned King and Agent of Treachery provide additional utility and ways to close out the game.

This deck focuses on playing powerful creatures like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Questing Beast as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive cards like Deputy of Detention and Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the board. The mana base is designed to consistently provide the colors needed to cast the spells in the deck. Overall, the goal of this deck is to apply pressure early and maintain a strong board presence to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Circuitous Route to get multiple lands on the battlefield. Once enough lands are in play, Golos, Tireless Pilgrim can be activated to search for Field of the Dead, generating a horde of Zombie tokens. Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Wipe provide control over the opponent's board while cards like Hydroid Krasis and Agent of Treachery offer additional value and disruption. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with its land synergy and powerful creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize the powerful creatures and planeswalkers in the Simic colors to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. By ramping up with mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Incubation Druid, as well as mana sources like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Castle Garenbrig, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats such as Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis. Cards like Once Upon a Time provide consistency, while Oko, Thief of Crowns can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of ramp, card advantage, and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on leveraging powerful Simic creatures and planeswalkers to apply relentless pressure on the opponent, utilizing acceleration from cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to quickly ramp into threats like Questing Beast, Hydroid Krasis, and Wicked Wolf. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Disdainful Stroke helps protect the board and keep the opponent off balance. Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Oko, Thief of Crowns offer additional versatility and power to the deck, while cards like Once Upon a Time provide consistency and card advantage.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Once Upon a Time, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Time Wipe and creatures like Kenrith, Agent of Treachery, and Realm-Cloaked Giant. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim is the key card in the deck, allowing the player to search for Field of the Dead and other utility lands to generate an army of Zombie tokens. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of Zombie tokens while maintaining control of the game with powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish early board control with cards like Deputy of Detention and Gilded Goose, ramp up with Paradise Druid and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and use powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Hydroid Krasis for card advantage and Agent of Treachery for additional control options. The overall strategy is to manage the board state and outvalue the opponent with efficient threats and removal spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to bring out powerful threats, such as Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Wipe. By utilizing Circuitous Route and Once Upon a Time, the deck can consistently hit its land drops, allowing for an overwhelming Field of the Dead activation. The deck also includes tools like Agent of Treachery and Realm-Cloaked Giant for additional control options and ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and combat tricks. By utilizing cards such as Edgewall Innkeeper and Faerie Guidemother to draw cards and provide additional value, along with powerful threats like Questing Beast and Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Giant Killer and Unbreakable Formation offer ways to disrupt opposing strategies and protect your own creatures.

The deck is focused on gaining and maintaining control of the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa, along with disruptive creatures like Deputy of Detention and Agent of Treachery. The deck also aims to ramp up its resources quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Once Upon a Time, while generating additional value with cards like Oko and Hydroid Krasis. With a mix of ramp, disruption, and powerful threats, this deck offers a versatile and strategic approach to controlling the game and outpacing opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, allowing you to play threats such as Hydroid Krasis, Questing Beast, and Wicked Wolf ahead of curve. Once Upon a Time helps to dig for the pieces you need, while Disdainful Stroke provides some disruption for your opponent's key spells. Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World serve as powerful planeswalkers that can help control the board and generate advantage. The land base is heavily focused on green sources to support the heavy green mana requirements of the deck.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and gaining card advantage through cards like Once Upon a Time and Growth Spiral. It aims to control the board with powerful spells such as Time Wipe and Agent of Treachery while also generating zombie tokens with Field of the Dead. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim serves as a key card in fetching lands from the deck, allowing for the quick activation of Field of the Dead. The deck ultimately aims to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with a combination of powerful creatures and control spells.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Growth Spiral, and Circuitous Route to quickly get to Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and start generating Zombie tokens with Field of the Dead. There are also various board wipes and removal spells like Realm-Cloaked Giant and Time Wipe to deal with threats, while Teferi, Time Raveler helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents with powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Agent of Treachery.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful land ETB effects and control spells. It aims to control the board with cards like Time Wipe and Teferi, Time Raveler while generating a constant stream of zombie tokens with Field of the Dead. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim helps find key lands while Agent of Treachery provides powerful stealing effects. The deck also uses Hydroid Krasis for card draw and life gain. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through controlling the board and generating strong land-based effects.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to establish board control and tempo through powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Nissa, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Deputy of Detention and Agent of Treachery. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Oko, Thief of Crowns, in order to cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis. The mana base is designed to support all three colors efficiently, allowing for flexibility in casting spells while maintaining a consistent stream of threats and disruption.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. The main win condition is generating a massive board presence with Field of the Dead and lands, while also utilizing powerful spells like Hydroid Krasis and Kenrith, the Returned King to gain card advantage and close out the game. Fae of Wishes allows for toolbox options to deal with various threats, while the rest of the deck focuses on ramping and staying alive until the late game where it can overwhelm the opponent.

The concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on playing efficient threats like Murderous Rider, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Legion's End. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge, and can quickly ramp up with Paradise Druid and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Rotting Regisaur, and Skarrgan Hellkite to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Collision / Colossus and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with threats from the opponent. The mana base allows for a consistent and efficient casting of spells, while cards like Embercleave and Gruul Spellbreaker provide additional combat tricks and protection. Overall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board of aggressive creatures, with a heavy emphasis on Knights. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and efficient threats like Venerable Knight, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Fervent Champion. With support from cards like Blacklance Paragon and Inspiring Veteran, the deck aims to close out the game quickly with cards like Embercleave. The inclusion of cards like Acclaimed Contender and Icon of Ancestry helps to maintain card advantage and find key pieces for the aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards such as Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route to play big threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. The key strategy is to control the board by using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Planar Cleansing to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up Field of the Dead for a steady stream of Zombie tokens to overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and consistently hitting land drops to power out its threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the game with planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset. Fae of Wishes allows for versatile wishboard options, while Kenrith provides additional utility. Deafening Clarion and Time Wipe help control the board, while cards like Shimmer of Possibility and Drawn from Dreams provide card advantage. Sarkhan the Masterless can create dragons as win conditions, and Ugin, the Ineffable offers removal. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route to cast powerful spells like Hydroid Krasis and Agent of Treachery. With Fires of Invention on the battlefield, you can play additional spells each turn without tapping your lands. The deck also includes cards like Deafening Clarion and Time Wipe to control the board and keep your opponent's creatures in check. The end goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a large army of Zombies generated by Field of the Dead and out-value them with high-impact spells and creatures.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through consistent creature plays and removal spells. By using efficient creatures like Edgewall Innkeeper, Foulmire Knight, and Questing Beast, along with disruption tools like Murderous Rider and Assassin's Trophy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory. With a good mix of card advantage, removal, and aggressive threats, this deck seeks to control the pace of the game and come out on top in combat situations.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of board wipes, ramp spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler. By ramping into powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis, as well as using the landfall triggers from Field of the Dead, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a wide board presence and card advantage. With a strong mix of control elements and powerful threats, this deck looks to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful combat tricks and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to put strong threats on the battlefield rapidly, using cards like Robber of the Rich and Questing Beast. Domri, Anarch of Bolas helps to generate additional mana and pumps up creatures, while Embercleave provides a game-ending boost for a hefty creature. With a mix of efficient creatures and combat tricks, this deck aims to swiftly deal damage and control the board to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy. Using cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Once Upon a Time to keep the deck running smoothly, this deck aims to flood the board with efficient creatures like Venerated Loxodon and Questing Beast. Faerie Guidemother and Shepherd of the Flock provide additional support and removal options, while cards like Giant Killer and Unbreakable Formation help maintain board control. Overall, the goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping mana with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to play powerful threats like Wicked Wolf, Hydroid Krasis, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides disruption and versatility, while cards like Growth Spiral help maintain card advantage. The deck also includes counter spells like Disdainful Stroke and Aether Gust for protection. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and mana ramping, while controlling the board with disruptive spells.

The main idea of this deck is to use a combination of powerful Simic creatures and planeswalkers to establish a fast and aggressive board presence. By utilizing cards such as Nissa, Oko, and Questing Beast, as well as mana ramp with Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with threats. Disdainful Stroke provides protection against opposing spells, while Once Upon a Time helps with consistency in finding key cards. The deck's strategy revolves around generating early pressure and maintaining tempo to secure the win.

The deck focuses on leveraging adventure creatures and Lucky Clover to generate card advantage and tempo, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Smitten Swordmaster. It also includes a strong removal package with cards like Murderous Rider and Blacklance Paragon to keep the opponent's board in check. The deck aims to outpace opponents with its fast starts and efficient creatures, backed up by card draw and removal to maintain board control.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful spells and control the board. Utilizing cards like Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral to accelerate land drops, it aims to get Golos, Tireless Pilgrim onto the battlefield to trigger Field of the Dead multiple times. With Teferi, Time Raveler for control and card advantage and Time Wipe for board removal, the deck aims to stall the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of zombie tokens generated by Field of the Dead.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of ramping cards, land synergies, and powerful control spells. By quickly ramping into Field of the Dead and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, the player can generate a swarm of Zombies to overwhelm the opponent. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control and disruption, while Time Wipe can clear the board if necessary. The deck also utilizes cards like Once Upon a Time and Risen Reef to facilitate card advantage and ensure a smooth mana base for the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of ramp and removal spells. By playing powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, as well as disruptive spells like Deputy of Detention and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents. Additionally, with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Agent of Treachery, the deck can steal or neutralize threats from the opponent. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration through Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to quickly cast its powerful spells.

The deck revolves around ramping to get out Field of the Dead as quickly as possible, generating zombie tokens with the lands and overwhelming the opponent with a large board presence. Fires of Invention allows for playing multiple spells in a turn without worrying about mana constraints, while Golos, Tireless Pilgrim can tutor for more lands or other spells to further control the game. The deck also includes removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Time Wipe to deal with threats, ensuring that the opponent struggles to keep up with the overwhelming zombie army.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to establish board control and tempo using a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Foulmire Knight, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast, along with powerful removal options like Murderous Rider and Legion's End, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board state. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provide additional value and card advantage to keep the pressure on and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures such as Lovestruck Beast, Foulmire Knight, and Questing Beast to quickly put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Murderous Rider and Legion's End to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to support the Golgari color combination and take advantage of cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World for ramp and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger for additional creature support.

The focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast, Faerie Guidemother, and Shepherd of the Flock. The deck aims to maintain a steady flow of threats by leveraging the card advantage provided by Edgewall Innkeeper and Once Upon a Time. Additionally, the deck includes support cards like Unbreakable Formation and Giant Growth to protect and enhance its creatures, while finishing off opponents with powerful finishers like Questing Beast and Venerated Loxodon.

This Simic Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and playing powerful threats such as Oko, Thief of Crowns, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Hydroid Krasis, and Wicked Wolf. The deck includes mana acceleration cards like Growth Spiral and Paradise Druid to get ahead of opponents and overwhelm them with large creatures. Disdainful Stroke is included for protection against opponent's big spells, while Brazen Borrower and Agent of Treachery provide additional utility. Castle Garenbrig and Gilded Goose provide extra mana sources to keep the aggression going. This deck aims to win through fast, efficient creature beats.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast, aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Wicked Wolf to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With ramp cards like Gilded Goose and Leafkin Druid, the deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Disdainful Stroke help to control the board and protect your creatures, while Once Upon a Time ensures a consistent start. The mana base is designed to consistently support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and planeswalkers, while also ramping up mana with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Paradise Druid. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to put early pressure on the opponent and maintain a strong board presence with efficient threats like Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis. It also utilizes cards like Deputy of Detention to remove potential blockers or threats from the opponent's side of the field.

This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful spells like Field of the Dead, Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, Hydroid Krasis, and Teferi, Time Raveler. By using cards like Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral, the deck aims to control the game by playing threats and answering opponent's plays efficiently. The deck also includes board wipes like Time Wipe and Realm-Cloaked Giant to deal with opponents' creatures. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful win conditions, this deck aims to dominate the late game and overwhelm opponents with its versatile threats.

The Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route, allowing players to play powerful spells like Time Wipe and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis to control the board and generate advantage. Additionally, cards like Risen Reef and Arboreal Grazer help fix mana and provide card advantage. The inclusion of Field of the Dead allows the deck to pressure opponents with zombie tokens while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Once Upon a Time to quickly reach the necessary mana to play powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis. The main win condition is Field of the Dead, which generates a horde of zombie tokens, overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Wipe to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently ramp, control the board, and win through zombie token generation.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral to get out multiple copies of Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Field of the Dead. The goal is to control the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Realm-Cloaked Giant, while also using Agent of Treachery to steal key cards from the opponent's side of the field. With a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and strategic control tactics.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient and powerful creatures to apply consistent pressure on the opponent. By combining cards like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Rankle, Master of Pranks with removal spells like Murderous Rider and Legion's End, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly. Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional utility and power to the deck, ensuring that it can adapt to various situations. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive gameplay, using cards like Overgrown Tomb and Temple of Malady for consistent mana fixing.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of powerful control spells and efficient ramping cards. By using cards like Time Wipe, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Oko, Thief of Crowns, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Circuitous Route, Growth Spiral, and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to quickly ramp up to its win condition of overwhelming the opponent with Field of the Dead tokens. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and outvalue the opponent in the late game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and deploying powerful threats like Wicked Wolf, Hydroid Krasis, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional disruption and threats, while Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid help accelerate the mana base. The deck also includes counterspells like Disdainful Stroke to protect key creatures and spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast mana development and high-impact threats to secure victories in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a high number of low-cost, aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Inspiring Veteran and Acclaimed Contender to buff your creatures and Embercleave to give them a powerful boost, you aim to rapidly reduce your opponent's life total before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all three colors of mana needed for your creatures and spells. The strategy of this deck is to be fast, efficient, and relentless in its assault on the opponent.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful late-game threats and control the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Realm-Cloaked Giant. By using cards like Circuitous Route and Growth Spiral, the deck aims to hit its land drops consistently to activate Field of the Dead and overwhelm the opponent with zombie tokens. The deck also includes versatile cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Hydroid Krasis to generate card advantage and provide additional win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a victory.

The deck focuses on rapidly deploying aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent. By utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and efficient mana costs, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while dealing consistent damage to the opponent. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and planeswalkers, the deck is able to adapt to various board states and maintain a proactive stance in the game. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and power to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By efficiently ramping into threats like Gruul Spellbreaker, Questing Beast, and Skarrgan Hellkite, as well as utilizing cards like Embercleave and Domri's Ambush to push through damage, this deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Once Upon a Time and Paradise Druid help to smooth out the deck's curve and ensure consistent early aggression.

This deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and dealing damage to the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. The synergy between Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Mayhem Devil allows for repeated damage and card advantage. Cards like Claim the Firstborn and Angrath's Rampage help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure. The deck aims to curve out efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and disruptive plays, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of creature damage and burn spells.
